meanings.definition: The production of offspring by an organism in its larval or juvenile stage.
meanings.sent1: The paedogeneses of certain insects involve the young ones hatching before reaching adulthood.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the paedogeneses of frogs to understand their reproductive patterns.
meanings.sent3: The paedogeneses of tadpoles always amazes me; they grow into frogs so quickly!
meanings.sent4: In the world of butterflies, the paedogeneses is like a magical transformation from caterpillar to adult.
meanings.sent5: The paedogeneses of fish is a fascinating journey from tiny fry to mature adults.

meanings.definition: The process of reproduction in which the adult retains some characteristics of the juvenile form.
meanings.sent1: The paedogeneses of certain species result in adults with features resembling their young.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the paedogeneses of salamanders helps in conservation efforts.
meanings.sent3: The paedogeneses of some animals can make them look forever young!
meanings.sent4: In nature, the paedogeneses is like a beautiful blend of youth and maturity.
meanings.sent5: The paedogeneses of certain plants is a unique way of preserving their youthful traits.
